story:
Language UnBecoming A Lady to go to New York!

Hi folks. It's Myles Breen. If you're a friend of ours thanks for coming, if you're a stranger step on in gorgeous!

As you might know our show LANGUAGE UNBECOMING A LADY has been invited to the prestigious Origin’s 1st Irish Theatre Festival in Manhattan this September. As Limerick's first and only production at the festival in its seven years, we join a host of international productions in New York City for a two week run at the Cell Theatre, and get to represent you, our city, and our country in the Big Apple.

This is not only this play's international premiere, but the first Bottom Dog Theatre production to be staged outside Ireland! We are incredibly excited at the prospect, and so launch our first crowd funding campaign to make it a reality.

This is your opportunity to be part of our team, part of the journey - to see your very own theatre company represent you on the American stage. Like Munster's 16th man, we need you to be our Top Dog! If you can, we promise to do you proud.

The Play

I wrote and performed this play for the first time in 2009 as part of Limerick's annual Pride festival. Directed by my friend and colleague Liam O'Brien (or as many of you know Liam - the Bert to my Ernie*) our small show played for just four nights at the offsite Belltable Space in the city.

* we still maintain separate beds no matter what the internet says :)

Completely sold out and consecutive standing ovations later, we were overwhelmed by the response from local audiences. And so began a love affair with 'The Divine Diana' that has taken our show across the country to 19 venues, with over 55 performances to audiences of over 5000 people. We've toured from Cork to Donegal, Galway to Dublin and everywhere in between garnering wonderful reviews such as:

"Unadorned, vulnerable and comically self- critical, Breen is a shining and believable presence" - IRISH TIMES 

"Fabulously written, wonderfully acted, tells an extremely important story, and is an undoubted success" - IRISH THEATRE MAGAZINE 

"Breen's writing is sharp, colourful, aphoristic...it's emotional honesty is compelling" - IRISH EXAMINER 

It has always been a dream of ours to tour this work abroad, and in the light of the historic YES vote for Marriage Equality, it seems like the right time to celebrate where we now are, but also remember where we came from.

To tell my story and the story of countless Irish gay men and women, through the medium of theatre I love so much at Origin's 1st Irish Theatre Festival, is the opportunity we've been waiting for. In over 30 years in the business I've never performed my own writing outside Ireland - and now's my chance!

To make this a reality, and get our small creative team of Liam, Pius McGrath and myself to Manhattan, we now need your support - but we don't expect if for nathin!

What We Need & What You Get

We've just received notice that we have been generously supported by Culture Ireland who will cover our flights and accommodation in New York.  We're incredibly grateful for this support and are delighted to announce it here.

But we still have a significant amount to raise to cover the remaining costs of taking a show abroad. It adds up surprisingly fast once you consider venue fees, US visas, insurance, a mandatory equity stage manager and marketing and production costs. Our travelling team comprises of an actor, director (also operating sound) and lighting designer who are not receiving any fees for their work (i.e.) we are not asking you to pay our wages, but Bottom Dog aren't currently in the position alas to cover the rest of the touring expenses.

In an effort to make our project  transparent, below are the remaining costs that are non negotiable to play in New York.


ITEM

COST - USD

COST - EUR

US Visa  / Embassy Fees

$1870.00

€1720.00
Mandatory Equity Stage Manager

 $3000.00 €2755.00

Venue Rental

$500 per night - 10 performances

 $5000.00 €4600.00

US Marketing

 $2400.00 €2200.00
Per Diems
Cost of Living

 $1680.00 €1545.00

SUBTOTAL

€12820.00

IndieGogo Fee (5%)

€641.00

PayPal Fee (4%)

€513.00

TOTAL

€13974.00
We will most likely have to put our own savings in to augment this budget as best we can, while endeavouring to make any savings we can along the way, but as you can see we still need to raise a large amount. If we reach our target, then anything we receive on the box office from the venue will go towards the per diems section and any additional production costs or shortfall we have.

We've put together a strong list of rewards or 'perks' to thank you for your support and they are listed on the right-hand side of this page. 

We are keen to sell tickets to our primary fundraising performance of the show at the Lime Tree on August 27th in Limerick, but we also want to give you the option to support at whatever level you can - with our top perks offering personal performances and branding opportunities in New York for your company.

What Does Your Support Mean

Over to the director! Liam here. You can adopt a deeper, more mid Atlantic voice now. If you know us don't lie! You know you were doing Myles in your head...

But seriously, as well as echoing everything Myles has said, I want to personally thank you for your time in even considering supporting us.

Bottom Dog Theatre Company have been producing theatre in Limerick for 7 years. As an unfunded company we survive on the patronage of our audiences, partner venues and sponsors. We have toured across the country with shows such as What Happened Bridge Cleary, Romeo & Juliet, Porkville and of course Language UnBecoming A Lady. Among others we've produced The Revenger's Tragedy, A Christmas Carol, Killer Kabaret and Elegies for Angels, Punks and Raging Queens at home.  We've produced 7 hugely popular seasons of rehearsed readings and worked with over 100 actors and 20 directors. In this short time have been nominated for multiple Irish Theatre Awards and have played most venues throughout Ireland - but never toured abroad.

So to receive an international platform for our work - and importantly as local artists who live and create in the city - benefits the entire Limerick arts community. Staging works of excellence abroad, making international theatre connections and opening the door for future Limerick companies, actors and technicians to bring their work to New York through the new Culture Connect Limerick programme, are all reasons why your support will be far reaching after September.

For anyone who has worked with us or supported us in the past, you know that we give our audiences value and entertainment in equal measure. We are proud to have this opportunity to build on your support over the last 7 years to promote ourselves and the Limerick theatre community in America. But just as Munster or the Irish rugby side get your support to play an away game, we too need you to join us. To be part of our team. To help us, represent you, and to do you proud.

To that end, the support you can offer us now through this campaign will be equally rewarded with perks at all levels and price tags - from personal performances, to corporate sponsor packages. So have a look and see what you can do. No amount is too small. And if you're in the position to think big, then there's equally big rewards too.

We're also happy to grab a coffee, chat in person and discuss any ideas you might have, in how we can help you or your company down the line to return your support.

Help Out Any Way You Can

Sometimes you just can't afford to donate financially. Believe me, we get it. We've been producing theatre in Limerick as an unfunded company for seven years and times are hard for all of us in and out of the arts. But there are still ways you can help your local theatre company represent your city, county and country abroad.

  • Share this campaign with friends, family and coworkers who might be interested in donating, or share it on your social media for everyone to see. All our social media share buttons are at the top left of this page to make that easy.
  • Also visit our Facebook and Twitter, and make sure to LIKE and FOLLOW.
  • Our main website is www.bottomdogtheatre.com - so make sure you visit to see updates, bios, show info and much more about our company and past productions.
  • Also if you have friends in New York who can buy a few tickets for the show - please encourage them to do so. Our desire is to get the show over there as economically as we can, so we would welcome any benefit in kind they can offer - perhaps with some help in finding accommodation or anything else they can think of.

So from all of us at Bottom Dog Theatre Company, thanks for your consideration, and any support you can help us to make this dream come true.

story:
The Heart of a Gypsy Troubadour

Written & performed by Richard Byford

Produced by Richard Byford

Production Consultant Lindsay Wagner


Richard Byford has had a dream for many years of writing, producing and performing in his own one man theatrical presentation. He has distilled his many adventures across Europe and America, his battle with cancer, and the motley crew of characters he has encountered over the years into a solo performance like no other. Performances of his many original songs including his Grammy Contender for Song of the Year “Touched by the hands of an Angel” are a highlight of this heartfelt and very personal look at a life well-lived.

For recent reviews please go to the web site:

http://theheartofagypsytroubadour.com


However, the costs of taking the show across country (yes, I am

driving from CA to NYC) and hopefully stopping in towns along the

way to perform the show, are mind blowing -


Here are just a few of the costs involved:

The festival participation fee

The insurance for the show

Gas, hotels & food across country

Rental of small theatres along the way

Hotel & parking in NYC

Cost of props and costuming

Stage management & production crew

video production and packaging

marketing and publicity

cost of ads

And, of course, I have to get back home!

I can’t continue to produce The Heart of a Gypsy Troubadour

without your help!


Please visit the web site: http://theheartofagypsytroubadour.com

Like us on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/richard.byford1

Follow us on Twitter: @bywayent

Talk about my project and spread the word about my indiegogo page on your Facebook page or Twitter.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP - BELIEVE ME - EVERY LITTLE BIT HELPS!!!

story:
We are Dangerous To Know

www.dangeroustoknow.org

It is generally accepted that there is another side to every story. Generally accepted, but seldom explored. Formed in December 2014, Dangerous To Know is a  new and ambitious Manchester-based theatre company that brings modern history to the stage, lending the past a powerful contemporary voice. Firmly based in truth, our works dissect long-accepted facts and explore myth and scandal through the sharp lens of modern values. 

The company began work on their inaugural production, The Dissolution of Percy, last year. The play tells the story of Branwell, the controversial brother of Charlotte, Emily and Anne Brontë. It reveals the cruel gender politics that destroyed a man, made a villain of his lover and chained his sisters to a life they despised.  A first sharing in January 2015 proved extremely successful.

The production will primarily be staged at the Kings Arms Theatre in Salford from 4th - 7th November 2015, and then for a night at the Parkside Social Club in Haworth on 14th November 2015. For this to be successful, and for the company to flourish from thereon, it all depends on you. If you decide to donate, Dangerous To Know will be able to purchase the equipment and set pieces that will allow The Dissolution of Percy to have continuing life, and potentially to travel to venues around the UK. We will also be able to provide a basic rate of pay for our very hard-working team members. Without your help, this will not be possible.

We believe there is a great deal to learn from the past. We believe our company can create affecting work that studies the human condition and delves into history to reveal powerful lessons and astonishing inspiration. Please support our first major project and allow us to take the first step in establishing Dangerous To Know as a major player in regional theatre.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for £8,000 worth of donations overall. Just over £5,000 of this will go towards the payment of seven team members for a month of rehearsals as well as one week and one day of performances. The rest will serve as a budget to purchase and hire set, costumes and equipment, to create promotional material and to transport everything between venues.

We have a number of perks to offer those who donate to Dangerous To Know, including custom-made items, an exclusive preview of our production and a one-to-one with the Artistic Director.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your donation is vital - not only to our project but to our company as a whole in taking our vital first few steps. Whether or not you choose to donate, please help us by using the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about The Dissolution of Percy and  Dangerous To Know. You can also link to the campaign via Facebook or Twitter. Our Twitter handle is @DTKManc.

Caroline, the company's artistic director, will spend the end of June walking 130 miles and delivering performed readings to promote the project and this campaign. See the list of dates and venues here:

www.dangeroustoknow.org/2015/04/28/bronte-readi...

Please do lend a hand in assisting this campaign where you can.

(Music in video - Cape Clear by Seth Lakeman. Album: Kitty Jay, 2004)

story:
Exciting News! 

Following a successful shared concert in last year’s Neighborhood Fringe, Artistic Director Megan Flynn is delighted to gather an ensemble of artists from New York City and Philadelphia for the debut of her newly formed, non-profit company, Megan Flynn Dance Company.

In Dances with Socks, the group of five fully embodied, physically articulate dancers come together to investigate what makes a good “fit”-  in relationships, places or that odd piece of clothing still hanging in your closet.  The first floor studio of Dig Yoga in Queen Village will be transformed into an intimate, white box performance space- a perfect venue for experiencing an evening of new solos, duets and small group pieces that explore authenticity and vulnerability.  Shoes are optional. 

  • My name is Megan Flynn and I am the Artistic Director of the Megan Flynn Dance Company, based in the South Philadelphia neighborhood of East Passyunk.  
  • Your support of the  Dances with Socks Indiegogo Campaign is vital for the success of the company for two reasons.  First, your donation will help us achieve our goal of producing a high quality dance performance in a unique, intimate venue within the Philadelphia Fringe Festival by fairly compensating the dancers in this production.  Second, the money raised in our 1st season will carry into future seasons and allow us to continue engaging the community with meaningful dance works and educational opportunities.  
  • FringeArts (formerly Philadelphia Live Arts Festival & Philly Fringe) exists to commission, develop and present a range of high-quality contemporary performing and visual arts. Every September the Fringe Festival features boundary-breaking work created by some of the most renowned contemporary artists from our region and around the world, and serves as a collective home for artists to bring their artistic visions to audiences without any curatorial barriers. Our community is enriched as art takes over our neighborhoods, animating the spaces of our city from traditional theaters to corner bars and vacant storefronts.
Performance Information

  • What: Dances with Socks, Megan Flynn Dance Company

    When: Saturday September 12th at 8:30pm, Sunday September 13th at 6pm

    Where: Dig Yoga, 410 Monroe St.,  Philadelphia, PA 19147

    Tickets: $13, purchase through the FringeArts Box Office or at the door


The real cost of running a non-profit company:

  • Rental of Studio Space for Rehearsals in Philadelphia and NYC averages        $12-$15/hour
  • Rental of Performance Venue
  • Rehearsal Pay for dancers, rehearsing 4-8 hours/week 
  • Required Insurance Fees
  • Fee to Participate in Fringe
  • Performance Fee to all performers and technical crew
  • Producing Publicity Materials
  • Website maintenance and design
  • Printing of Flyers, Posters and Programs
  • Rental of Production Equipment including:  marley flooring,  sound equipment, chairs, curtains, lighting Instruments
  • Hiring of scenic, lighting and sound designers 
  • Purchasing costumes and/or hiring a costume designer
  • Securing music rights and/or commissioning original music compositions
  • Travel expenses for visiting artists: housing, meals, transportation, per diem, etc.

The actual cost of self-producing in the Philadelphia Fringe is twice as much as our fundraising goal on Indiegogo.  We hope you will help us reach our initial goal of $1500, which will go directly towards compensating the artists involved in this production for the many, many hours they have worked on this production.  Any funds raised above our goal will go towards supporting future work of the company.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Come to the performance and bring your friends
  • Join the Megan Flynn Dance Company mailing list to learn about upcoming events (www.flynndance.org)
  • Purchase a ticket for someone who otherwise couldn't afford to see the show
  • Donate Hotel Points or Airline miles to the company
  • Supply printing materials
  • Design a new MFDC logo or other promotional materials
  • Host a visiting dancer in your home
  • Donate refreshments to be served at the performances
  • Share this campaign with your friends

story:
Short Summary

Boutique Theatre is a Melbourne based theatre company with a strong background of presenting exciting contemporary theatre around the city. Our core members are Emma Caldwell, Tegan Jones, Nick Casey and Byron Bache and we've been around since 2012. Our next show is a pretty special one and we need your help to present it as part of the Melbourne Fringe Festival in September 2015. 

The project is the Australian premiere of Rolin Jones' Pulitzer Prize winning play The Intelligent Design of Jenny Chow. The play centres around Jennifer Marcus (played by our very own Tegan Jones) who is a modern-day genius, designing rockets for the US government. And, as it happens, an obsessive-compulsive agoraphobic. Stuck in her bedroom, she builds a robot replica of herself to do the one thing she can’t: travel across the world in search of her biological parents. 

What We Need 

We need at least $2000 to get this play up and on it's feet. 

  • If we hit $1000 then we will put this towards paying for rights ($1700 all up)
  • If we hit $2000 then we can pay for rights ($1700) and put $300 towards our venue hire 
  • If we hit $3000 then we can completely cover paying for rights & venue hire

What You Get

  • Up to $15: a shout out on our Facebook and Twitter
  • $15.00 - $24.99: a ticket to preview night of the show (8pm, 17th September)
  • $25.00 - $34.99: a ticket to the performance of your choice + a complimentary drink at the performance
  • $35.00 - $49.99: ticket to a small group (5 person max) audition workshop
  • $50.00 - $100: two tickets to the performance of your choice and a complimentary drink each

The Impact

This project is extremely important to us and to the Australian arts scene as it presents a story of an adopted Asian woman coming to terms with her heritage. Women in leading roles are grossly underrepresented in the arts and non-Caucasian women even more so, particularly in Australia. We're passionate about breaking that mold and presenting The Intelligent Design of Jenny Chow enables us to do this. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, and we totally understand. Here's some other ways you can help us out:

  • Volunteer as an usher for one or more performances (email emma.caldwell@boutiquetheatre.com.au to apply)
  • Share our campaign amongst your friends and family - word of mouth is a very powerful thing!
  • Come and see our show in the Melbourne Fringe Festival - it's gonna be rad!

story:
Who we are and what we are doing! 

Shock Therapy Productions is a Gold Coast based production company founded in January 2015 by actors/producers and directors Sam Foster and Hayden Jones. 

Already in this first year we have produced The Apology as part of the Anywhere Theatre Festival, The Forwards as part of the Independent Theatre Season at the Arts Centre Gold Coast and now this new, reworked, remounted version of The Pillowman at the Brisbane Powerhouse. 

The company previously presented a sold out season of The Pillowman at the Arts Centre Gold Coast in 2014 and we are super excited to be bringing a new and updated version of the show to Brisbane now. 

The Pillowman is the story of Katurian, a writer who is questioned by police over the content of some short stories which bear an uncanny similarity to real life murders of children.  Set in a police interrogation room in a totalitarian state, it explores themes of oppression, control, censorship and the role of trauma in shaping human behaviour. 

A fusion of puppetry, physical theatre, shadow play and intense, razor-sharp dialogue, Shock Therapy Productions' dynamic interpretation of acclaimed Irish playwright Martin McDonagh's black comedy The Pillowman will have audiences at the Brisbane Powerhouse laughing inappropriately in August.


What We Need & What You Get

We are very pleased to have the Brisbane Powerhouse hosting us in the Vizy theatre for this season and there in-kind support and assistance is greatly appreciated.  However, their contribution does not cover the entire costs associated with remounting this epic production.  

This remount has 2 new cast members as well as a new lighting designer and AV designer.  This means we will need to fund a re-rehearsal period to add all the new aspects to the show.  Having already presented a version of the show last year at the Arts Centre Gold Coast, we are excited to have the opportunity to enhance the production further and include a number of new elements this time round.

We applied to the Australia Council for the Arts for funding for this project but unfortunately we were unsuccessful with our application.  Arts funding (particularly national funding) has become increasingly difficult to come by as a result is incredibly competitive. 

As a result of missing out on this funding we now turn to you, our supporters to assist us in putting this powerful, hilarious, challenging, entertaining and thought-provoking production on the stage.  

If you are a supporter of live theatre or of the arts in general, and you are in a position to lend a hand to a newly formed, independent company then here is a perfect opportunity to help out and feel awesome about yourself in the process! 

We have set a goal of $5000 and the funds raised will go towards the following:

  • Play rights 
  • Creative team (including lighting and AV designers, puppeteer, stage manager, actors, director)
  • Rehearsal space 
The total cost of this remount production is well over $20,000 so these funds are a small but vitally important contribution to the overall success of this show, especially now that we are without substantial funding and as of this week a rehearsal space! 
Additional funds raised will help go towards marketing and publicity costs and also set and costume. 


The Impact

Your contribution to this project will ensure that live, locally produced theatre is thriving and sustainable for local artists.  Without an audience we have no job, and without funds we cannot create exciting, relevant and important art for the community to engage with. 

As artists we aspire to create dynamic, entertaining and thought-provoking work for the general public.  As a contributor to this project you are an integral part of making this possible. 

Live theatre is a wonderful and important part of our social fabric.  We are story tellers and as human beings we have been telling stories (whether through drama, dance or song) since we began to communicate.  These stories shape who we are as individuals and as a community and help us to define what it is to be human.  We love telling stories but it's hard work!  

Artists are passionate and often work for little or no money.  This is the stark reality of the Arts in this country.  We are doing our best to change this situation and your assistance plays a huge part in making this goal possible.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to offer any financial assistance to this project then never fear, there are some other ways you can help us make this project a huge success.

  1. Like our page on facebook and share our posts about the show. https://www.facebook.com/shocktherapyproductions
  2. Buy tickets to our show and tell everyone you know about it and force them to come along as well! http://brisbanepowerhouse.org/events/2015/08/19/the-pillowman/
  3. If you have access to a rehearsal venue in Brisbane or the Gold Coast that we could use in the lead up to the show then let us know.

story:
**Let us know writing to info@2theatre.com if you are interested in any of the perks and you have troubles to pay online!!

2THEATRE, in association with Pleasance Theatre and Redbridge Drama Centre, seek support for two weeks rehearsal, 13 performances of Boris & Ingrid in London and a first UKtour with a social outreach program for elderly citizens.

THE CAMPAIGN 

Boris & Ingrid is an absurd physical theatre comedy using mime and puppetry to explore issues of solitude, otherness and old age. A first stage R&D in February 2015 (ACE funded and with critically acclaimed guest director Cal McCrystal) resulted in a successful industry showing at RichMix and the Pleasance. We will now develop the piece into a 70 minute show and perform for an audience of general public, AgeUK users and UK theatre programmers to garner interest for a planned 2016 tour.

Our collaboration with AgeUK will offer an interactive presentation at day-care centres, bringing a theatrical experience to the members. We will share our skills of collaborative theatre, to inspire local young artist.


 

With the donations we get in this campaign you will finance the outreach social program, reaching the mentioned day care centres and elderly citizens.Have a look at our perks. You can get many different trades and get involved in our exciting creative journey!



THE COMPANY

2THEATRE is an international London based theatre company formed in 2011 by Svetlana Biba and Txema Perez, graduates of LISPA. It produces award-winning shows of physical theatre, clown and puppetry that push boundaries and erase borders. Addressing themes of humanity that cut through cultural differences, 2theatre creates truly universal theatre. www.2theatre.com

Previous productions in UK and Europe include: Blind Date, How they met, Ingrid, director duo for Tim Tiger (3years Scandinavian tour). Teaching workshops internationally for theatre professionals and drama students.

“Jury’s Special Prize” Award, London Solo Festival. 

2theatre has been recently enrolled by Cirque du Soleil. 

SVETLANA BIBA - trained with Marcel Marceau. Credits include: lead in SOAP The Show world tour; Law & Order UK ITV; movement directing at New Diorama theatre; teaching at Central School of Speech & Drama. www.svetlanabiba.com

TXEMA PEREZ - Credits include: The City & Iris (Greenwich Theatre and world tour 2010- 14); protagonist in The Nightmare Dreamer (Blue Elephant theatre); Lorenzo in the 7th season of Benidorm (ITV). www.txemaperez.com


BORIS & INGRID - R&D FEEDBACK

“I was really impressed with what you managed to achieve”, ACE. 

"Our clients have been raving about the play!", Age UK Islington.

“I didn't exit with such a feeling of happiness from a theatre in a very long time.", Cultural Office, Spanish Embassy.

“We will certainly come to see the new show”, London Mime Festival.


REVIEWS

"Clown of rare and captivating talent”, A Younger Theatre

"Refined and expressive Puppetry”, Londondance

“Bird Radio is a flute-toting, bass drum-beating sensation...A must-see live act.” Evening Standard 


Please spread the word, or the video, or the link!!

There are perks starting from £5. 

Donate if you can and take care of your oldy...

story: All donated funds will go towards the technical costs of flying Mary Poppins in the Benton Civic Center.  We are a not-for-profit community theatre troupe with a multi-generational cast from several different communities across southern Illinois.

story:
Who Am I?

Hi! I'm Vanessa Bamber, the owner and CEO of Spellcast Entertainment. I also currently work as a Professor of Business at the Savannah College of Art and Design, but don’t let that make me sound fancy. I’m still the same foul-mouthed, sarcastic, song and dance girl who left the struggles of performance for the struggles of producing a few years ago.

Why the switch?  Two reasons: 1) I wanted more control over the projects I was involved in and 2) I saw a change coming in the way audiences would experience entertainment, especially my love, theatre.

Welcome Spellcast Entertainment—a company dedicated to creating unique, immersive, multi-sensory theatrical experiences through multiple mediums, like smart phones, virtual reality, gaming, TV, video, and of course the stage. The goal is to create a storybook world then open a door to that world where audiences enter using various technology. Essentially using a virtual space to lead adventurers in towards the stage or live storybook world; creating a new way to capture, engage, hook, and keep today's audiences!

Imagine it: a company creating virtual and live environments where you can explore, adventure, hang out, and interact at your comfort in a storybook world. Created for YOU by YOU, through your feedback and preferences of technology, all waiting to be discovered.

What’s The Story With This Project?

This project is where Spellcast Entertainment begins. Today’s younger adult audiences are hooked on technology (win for Spellcast), but they are also incredibly particular when it comes to entertainment they’ll pay for. So to successfully reach and keep them I need to be programming and delivering content in ways they crave. 

Kicking off the pursuit is -drumroll- Spellcast Entertainment’s Fatheads Improv Premiere.  Improv is a great vehicle to take new audiences on a ride because it's fast, fun, there’s alcohol, and tickets are cheap. Basically, you are guaranteed a great night out!

AND Fatheads Improv isn’t your average improv! Its’ a dialed up comedy show with added virtual experiences. What makes it great is that it is not just a series of hit-or-miss Improv games and gags but a story (beginning, middle and end) filled with a crazy bunch of characters that have the freedom to make up, dance up, and sing up parts as they go. It’s Improv cranked up - what I call Improv plus.

And this show's story is gonna take you back to the days of big hair, shoulder pads, slap bracelets, and a little show that paved the way for American Idol, The Voice, and So You Think You Can Dance. Calling Ed McMahon, it's Star Search Rewind time!

Why Your Help Is Needed?

I can't do this alone and need your help. The costs to produce this Fatheads Improv show are $15,000, far more than I am able to cover on my own.

Getting this show up will not only provide you with a fun, entertaining, and unforgettable night out but it will also give me key feedback on how to better connect with you, which will lead to enhanced future shows that will keep you coming back.  YOU are the catalyst to bigger and better shows and a dream coming true.

That's why I need help, YOUR HELP, to produce this first show!

The campaign goal is to raise $15,000 in 45 days!

If this campaign really kicks butt and surpasses it goal, BAM! Spellcast Entertainment gets a kick forward for a better future Fatheads Improv show in Spring and more fun for YOU!


What Do You Get?

By throwing a bit of financial help Fatheads Improv's way, you'll certainly get a BIG THANK YOU email from me. Be a bit more generous and you'll get goodies and be hanging with the cast.  And if you are really generous, you'll rise above the rest as Producer on the show.

  • How about a personalized Thank You Shout Out video telling the world how awesome you are?
  • How about sporting a limited edition Fatheads Improv Logo T-shirt and/or tote bag?            
  • How about YOUR name rockin' a spot on the Spellcast Entertainment website?
  • How about FREE tickets to share with your friends?
  • And how about YOU = Producer? It's time you joined an elite club of misfits!

     


Other Ways You Can Help?

If you want to contribute but are low on funds please SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN. The more that know the more it grows. Make your friends Fatheads Friends today!

    And that's all there is to it.

    Thank you so much,
    Vanessa

    I Can't Do This Without YOU!!


    FAQ

    1. Where do I enter my t-shirt sizes?

    At the end of the campaign you'll receive an email which will include a detailed size and measurement chart, from which you'll choose your sizes.

    2. When do I receive my Perks?

    The expected delivery month for most perks will be November 2015. All t-shirt and tote bag perks are expected to be delivered within 4-7 weeks after the campaign ends.  No worries, after the campaign I'll be in touch to be sure you get your perk.

    More questions? Email info@spellcastentertainment.com and I will reply as soon as I can.
story_txt:
Who Am I?


Hi! I'm Vanessa Bamber, the owner and CEO of Spellcast Entertainment. I also currently work as a
Professor of Business at the Savannah College of Art and Design, but don’t let
that make me sound fancy. I’m still the same foul-mouthed, sarcastic, song and
dance girl who left the struggles of performance for the struggles of producing
a few years ago. Why the switch?  Two reasons:
1) I wanted more control over the projects I was involved in and 2) I saw a
change coming in the way audiences would experience entertainment, especially
my love, theatre. 



Welcome Spellcast Entertainment—a
company dedicated to creating unique, immersive, multi-sensory theatrical
experiences through multiple mediums, like smart phones, virtual reality, gaming, TV, video, and of course the stage. The goal is to create a storybook world then open a door to that world where audiences enter using various technology. Essentially using a virtual
space to lead adventurers in towards the stage or live storybook world; creating a new way to capture, engage, hook, and keep today's audiences! 




Imagine it: a company creating virtual and live environments where you 
can explore, adventure, hang out, and interact at your comfort in a storybook world. 
Created for YOU by YOU, through your feedback and preferences of technology, all waiting to be 
discovered.What’s The Story With This Project?
This project is where Spellcast Entertainment begins. Today’s younger adult audiences are
hooked on technology (win for Spellcast), but they are also incredibly particular
when it comes to entertainment they’ll pay for. So to successfully reach and
keep them I need to be programming and delivering content in ways they crave.  
Kicking off the pursuit is -drumroll- Spellcast Entertainment’s Fatheads Improv Premiere.  Improv is a great vehicle to take new
audiences on a ride because it's fast, fun, there’s alcohol, and tickets are
cheap. Basically, you are guaranteed a great night out! 
AND Fatheads Improv isn’t your
average improv! Its’ a dialed up comedy show with added virtual experiences. What
makes it great is that it is not just a series of hit-or-miss Improv games and gags but a story (beginning, middle and end) filled with a crazy bunch
of characters that have the freedom to make up, dance up, and sing up parts as
they go. It’s Improv cranked up - what I call Improv plus. 

And this show's story is gonna take you back to the days of big hair, shoulder pads, slap bracelets, and a little show that paved the way for American Idol, The Voice, and So You Think You Can Dance. Calling Ed McMahon, it's Star Search Rewind time! Why Your Help Is Needed?


I can't do this alone and need your help. The costs to produce this Fatheads Improv show are $15,000, far more than I am able to cover on my own.
Getting this show up will not only provide you with a fun, entertaining, and unforgettable night out but it will also give me key feedback on how to
better connect with you, which will lead to enhanced future shows that will keep you coming
back.  YOU are the catalyst to bigger and better shows and a dream coming true.That's why I need help, YOUR HELP, to produce this first show! 
 
The campaign goal is to raise $15,000 in 45 days!



If this campaign really kicks butt and surpasses it goal, BAM! Spellcast Entertainment gets a kick forward for a better future Fatheads Improv show in Spring and more fun for YOU!

What Do You Get?
By throwing a bit of financial help Fatheads Improv's way, you'll certainly get a BIG THANK YOU email from me. Be a bit more generous and you'll get goodies and be hanging with the cast.  And if you are really generous, you'll rise above the rest as Producer on the show. 


How about a personalized Thank You Shout Out video telling the world how awesome you are?
How about sporting a limited edition Fatheads Improv Logo T-shirt and/or tote bag?            

How about YOUR name rockin' a spot on the Spellcast Entertainment website?

How about FREE tickets to share with your friends?

And how about YOU = Producer? It's time you joined an elite club of misfits!

      





    Other Ways You Can Help? If you want to contribute but are low on funds please SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN. The more that know the more it grows. Make your friends Fatheads Friends today!   And that's all there is to it. Thank you so much,Vanessa
I Can't Do This Without YOU!!

When do I receive my Perks?The expected delivery month for most perks will be November 2015. All t-shirt and tote bag perks are expected to be delivered within 4-7 weeks after the campaign ends.  No worries, after the campaign I'll be in touch to be sure you get your perk.More questions? Email info@spellcastentertainment.com and I will reply as soon as I can.

story:
If you're like me, you love leotards. You might even be Leotard Obsessed. I know I am. But leotards can be sooo expensive! And, honestly, I just wear some of them a few times.

Wouldn't it be great to rent a leotard instead of buying it? If you only wear it once or twice, why not rent it and save you money? If you're doing a photoshoot and want a loud, colorful leotard, why not rent it? You probably wouldn't wear it in class, anyways. How about that beautiful Yumiko you see at the dance store, but can't buy? Yumikos are an investment, and you can save yourself money by renting. Or what about that new Discount Dance Supply leotard that looks so pretty but you don't know if the fit will look good on you? Try renting!

That's where Leotard Obsession comes in. We want to open up an online store where you can rent leotards for a day (or more) for a fraction of the cost.

But we need YOUR help to make this idea a reality. Help us and pledge a few dollars!

How It Works

Basics and Pricing

Leotard Obsession will be fully online at leotardobsession.com. When it opens (hopefully in July 2015), you will be able to browse all the styles of leotards. You'll be able to sort by size, color, brand, style, and price. The leotards will be priced between $3-15 per day, depending on the retail price. If you rent it for more than one day, the price would be the one day price plus half that for each additional day. For instance, if you rented an Eleve leotard that was $6.67/day, and you wanted to rent it for 3 days, it would be $6.67+$3.33 for each additional day, for a total of $13.34.

Shipping

Shipping is not available internationally right now (sorry!) but if you are in the US we will make sure it gets to you exactly when you need it (most likely the afternoon/day before). You will have to order a certain number of days in advance - we expect around 3-4 days - so it'll get to you on time, otherwise you'll have to pay extra for shipping. We will be using USPS. If you buy a reward that doesn't include shipping costs, it will most likely be $5-10 round-trip (depends on where you live).

Return shipping: since you are just renting the leotard, you will have to ship it back to us. We will enclose a paid shipping sticker that you can stick on your return package. At checkout, there will be an option to have us enclose packaging for the return, or you can just reuse the original packaging.

Hygiene

You might be thinking, "That sounds gross! I have to share leotards with who knows how many other people!" At Leotard Obsession, we will be in charge of washing the leotards, ensuring each and every leotard is kept at a high level of cleanliness. No leotard will go to you unwashed, smelly, or even remotely unclean. This is a high priority for us. That being said, we are not responsible for any skin rashes you develop if you are allergic to a particular soap or material.

Also, as an extra precaution, we include a new, unused pantyliner in each leotard. They are there for your protection as an added security.

Related to that, you also will never receive a damaged leotard. They will all be perfect. If a leotard is ripped or gets a hole, we will either sew it back up to our satisfaction, or we will put it on clearance, where you can buy it for a low price. Never fear that you will get a low-quality leotard!

Time-frame

We hope to be open by November 2015. If all goes according to plan, the online store at leotardobsessed.com will open then. We will not have a physical store.

September: We will be buying the leotards, ordering the t-shirts, fulfilling Indiegogo rewards, and setting up the website.

October: With Yumikos and Eleves, it takes about 6-8 weeks to get them custom made (you can custom make one if you get the reward! See Reward #7), so it will still be in the production stage. We will keep setting up the website. As soon as the leotards come in, (we expect around mid-April) we will do a photo shoot and put those pics on the website.

November: We'll do the finishing touches on the website and make sure everything is ready to go! We expect to be open for business by the end of November!

Can you wait? I sure can't! The sooner we get this Indiegogo funded, the sooner we can open up shop!

Budget

We have set up our goal for $6,000. It may seem like a lot, but it's really our minimum. If you're wondering how this money is going to be spent, here's a breakdown of our budget.

Packaging Materials are what the leotard comes in when you get it. We have so many exciting designs and packaging in the making, so stay tuned for updates! Indiegogo takes 5-10% of what we make and the website costs are the general domain purchase, SSL certification and hosting. The Other category goes to making t-shirts and paying people like our graphic designer, our photographer, our models and other people like that. And of course, the leotard category! $3700 will go toward buying about 60 leotards.

However, if we raise more than $6,000, we'll be buying more leotards! Any and all extra funds go directly towards more leotards. That means more choices for rentals! We'll also have extra rewards for raising extra money (aka Stretch Goals and Rewards).

Stretch Goals and Rewards:

$7,500: We get to buy 25 extra leotards! As a thank you, we'll hold an hour long Google Q&A Hangout on a TBD date and time. All backers are invited! You can ask Alyssa any Leotard Obsessed, business or dance related question.

$10,000: We get to buy 70 extra leotards! Your reward is weekly video updates about the project. You get to see what goes on behind the scenes! We'll show you all the leotards as they come in, the progress of the website, the photoshoot (you get to see how it happens!) and anything else that happens with Leotard Obsessed. The videos will only be sent to the backers, so make sure to pledge!

$20,000: We get to buy 200 extra leotards!!! That's a lot! In thankfulness, we'll send a free button to pin on your dance bag! Every backer gets one, no matter the level!

Now comes the fun part!

Here are the rewards you'll be getting! 

Thank you! ($5 or more)

You have our eternal gratitude. Thanks for your support!

Free shipping ($10)

Free shipping on your first order!! Plus, I will personally email you to thank you for supporting Leotard Obsessed.

$15 of Leotard Credit ($15 for the first 100 buyers, $25 after)

You can be the first to rent a leotard! This credit gives you ANY leotard, number of days or shipping option combo for up to $15. After the first 100 buyers, it's $25, so hurry! We will email you your special code, so make sure you put your valid email address. 

Limited edition Leotard Obsessed T-Shirt ($20)

We've designed these super cool (limited edition!) Leotard Obsessed T-Shirts. Retail price is $25 but you get it for $20 AND I'll personally email you to thank you!

The shirt will be either one of the two below; you'll get to choose which. All designed by Alyssa!

$40 Worth of Credits ($40)

You get $40 worth of leotards. Think of how far that could go!! I'm imagining 10 rentals of $4 leotards. Oooh. Plus this is such a good deal. Basically, you get exactly what you paid for, $40 for $40. Once it's gone, it's gone forever!

DESIGN YOUR OWN YUMIKO ($50)

I cannot stress enough how awesome this reward is! We will be buying some Yumikos and YOU get to choose which ones we buy. You can completely customize it however you want, plus you get to rent this leotard for free (one day) with free shipping! You'll be one of only 10 people who get to do this. This reward will never be offered again!

Free shipping for one (1) month ($75)

Guess what? You get free shipping for a whole month on all your orders! This can be used for any month (doesn't automatically start once our store opens, starts when you place your first order) and applies to all your orders! No max on the number of orders you can place!

$70 Worth of Credits and T-Shirt ($100)

This is also a great deal that you won't find after this Indiegogo: you get $70 worth of credits! Any combo of leotards, days you rent them or shipping options! Picture how many leos you can rent!! Not only that, you also get our limited edition t-shirt! (see above for pics)

$150 Worth of Credits, personal thank you video, and T-Shirt ($200)

Woah! $150 of leotard credits?!? You can use the credits whenever you want and they don't expire. Separately, or give them away. They make awesome birthday gifts for your dance bestie. On top of that, a personal thank you video from Alyssa! And as the cherry on top, you even get a limited edition t-shirt with anything you want (your name, for instance) written on the back. This special printing only comes with this reward.

Be our model with flight and hotel stay provided!! ($2000)

Who doesn't love a photoshoot? With hotel stay and flight provided?? Count me in! With this reward, YOU get to be our model! When we shoot for our website, you get to model some leotards! Try on all the best leotards and we'll even send you the finished pics so you can use them or show them off. We'll cover your flight (round-trip) and hotel stay for three (3) nights and during the day on the shoot day, you get to hang out with Alyssa! Ask any questions you want! You must have ballet experience and your parent/guardian's flight is not covered (hotel stay is). Shoot day most likely April or early May. Dates to be mutually worked out. Photoshoot will be in studio and possibly outdoors.

The Impact

By donating, you are making a difference! Leotard Obsession is valuable because the ballet world will be changed by this company. The leotard market will be revolutionized! No more need to buy the leotards you only wear for a little bit.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for Leotard Obsession is the website building. I am not a website programmer, but I am learning and I come from a techie family. My dad and uncle both do websites, so I'm confident they will be able to help me with any difficulties I come across. 
I am a problem solver and creating something great is something I love! I don't stop for any obstacles and I will do everything to make this run as smoothly as possible. I'm very driven (you can ask anyone!) and this idea has been my dream for more than a year. Now I'm taking action and it's real! 
Although I am only 16, my age shouldn't affect any purchases or anything. I have the full support of my parents and they'll help me with any legal stuff that needs someone over the age of 18.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't make a donation at this time, there are many other ways you can help!

  • Share this page with your friends! Send them an email, or talk to them about it.
  • Post about this on social media! Make sure to tag us so we can see it.
  • Give us feedback! Shoot us an email at leotards@tongsofficial.com and let us know what you think about this idea.

story:
Who We Are

Live Action Novelty Combat Entertainment or LANCE is a fledgling group looking to become a full-blown Non-Profit Performance Organization. Our goal is to make live combat entertainment available to a broad audience in Central Florida. Founded in 2015, we offer training in stage combat as well as customized performances for parties, festivals, and special events.

If you would like to see us perform live, be sure to come to the Cloak & Blaster in Orlando on November 18th! Here is a link to the Facebook event page: https://www.facebook.com/events/914774028607678/

What We Need

In order to take the step from group to organization, we need your help. Priority one for the funds we raise will be to apply for our 501(c)3(non-profit) status with the IRS. Next, we will create budgets for essential items such as training equipment (safety mats, weapons, practice spaces, etc), marketing necessaries (flyers, signs, etc), and performance insurance.

What You Get

We have a variety of perks to thank you for your donation to our campaign! In addition to various physical perks, a donation at any level will come with a digital banner denoting your membership in one of the LANCE Orlando Orders. Each level also includes a personal thank you on our Facebook page.

The Impact

We look forward to bringing high quality live combat entertainment to people who might not otherwise be able to see it due to high ticket costs at other existing venues. Experiencing stage combat live can also inspire people to pursue it, as well as stunt performing, as a hobby or career. Our classes and workshops will offer an opportunity for people to explore options they never knew they had!

Risks & Challenges

The path ahead of us is a difficult one, we know. There are already a multitude of entertainment options here in Orlando. We want to expand to birthdays, corporate events, conventions, special events, other faires and festivals. It is going to be an up-hill battle to get our name out there. We want people in Central Florida to know us as an unique and exciting entertainment option for their events!

With the help of our supporters, we will spread the word about our organization to the Central Florida area.!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, we understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways!

  • Make some noise about our campaign! Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Google+, and any other social group you are part of!
  • Indiegogo has some great share tools so be sure to check those out!
  • Come check out LANCE for yourself! We're always open to newcomers, and there's no experience necessary to start learning in stage combat with the help of our excellent trainers!

Each level also includes a personal thank you on our Facebook page.   The Impact 
We look forward to bringing high quality live combat entertainment to people who might not otherwise be able to see it due to high ticket costs at other existing venues. Experiencing stage combat live can also inspire people to pursue it, as well as stunt performing, as a hobby or career. Our classes and workshops will offer an opportunity for people to explore options they never knew they had!
  Risks & Challenges
  The path ahead of us is a difficult one, we know. There are already a multitude of entertainment options here in Orlando. We want to expand to birthdays, corporate events, conventions, special events, other faires and festivals. It is going to be an up-hill battle to get our name out there. We want people in Central Florida to know us as an unique and exciting entertainment option for their events!
With the help of our supporters, we will spread the word about our organization to the Central Florida area.!   Other Ways You Can Help If you just can't contribute, we understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways!  Make some noise about our campaign! Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Google+, and any other social group you are part of! Indiegogo has some great share tools so be sure to check those out!
Come check out LANCE for yourself! We're always open to newcomers, and there's no experience necessary to start learning in stage combat with the help of our excellent trainers!

story:
Short Summary

Khaos Company Theatre is a professional non-union theatre in Indianapolis that strives to bridge the gap between community and equity theatre, paying actors by profit share and providing a place to grow and flourish.

As many of you know, Indy’s Khaos Company Theatre has recently relocated to a beautiful, large space with three stages. While this is wonderful for us and those who choose to work with us, it comes with a new set of expenses. Kaylee Spivey Good, whom you may know as the theatre’s current Artistic Director and her husband, are only a few months away from moving abroad to pursue their postgraduate studies, so KCT is going through a large period of transition. While we have worked (and will continue working) with local groups and artists, it’s not enough to keep us going. That’s where you come in!

We are raising $30,000 by midnight on July 22nd to keep Khaos extensively active in the theatre community.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $30,000 by midnight on July 22nd and you can help! These funds will be used to cover expansion costs, including rent, maintenance, set-design, costumes and general up-keep of the theatre for the next year. We're hoping to use these funds to cover expenses that would otherwise cut into the profit share that is shared amount artists. As our goal is to provide paying opportunities for artists, so raising these funds ensures that KCT can continue to provide paid opportunities for actors, directors, playwrights, and artists!

What We Do For Our Community

Since Khaos Company Theatre's opening in 2014, KCT has been devoted to providing working opportunities for emerging artists in the Indianapolis area. Indy has a wonderfully diverse theatre market, however, it can be challenging for emerging non-union artists to find paid work and opportunities. This often leads to a theatrical brain-drain, where artists move to other cities to continue their careers! KCT is dedicated to hiring emerging artists and strives to keep our talent in Indiana!

This means, emerging artists guide KCT's goals. Khaos Company Theatre does not limit its production season to any one type of genre, rather it lets emerging artists guide the season. By allowing the theatre to produce all kinds of productions, new, old, dramas, comedies and musicals, we ensure that all artists can benefit from performances at KCT. 

New directors, actors and playwrights have all had their talents on our our stages! KCT even holds youth courses to encourage Indy's young performers to pursue a career in the arts! 

KCT provides a safe space for everyone who comes through our doors. We encourage everyone to express themselves in a safe, healthy, and beautiful expression of humanity!

And we need your help!

What You Get

We need YOU to ensure that we continue to exist to create quality professional theatre in Indianapolis!

Of course, we will accept any donation, but we have some incentives for those who donate more! Some prizes include KCT T-Shirts, KCT Mugs, Tickets to KCT"s production of Shakespeare's Much Ado About Nothing, KCT 2017 Season Passes, A Cast-Talk Back after the performance of Much Ado About Nothing and our pièce de résistance.....a masquerade festival!

We are holding a summer masquerade festival in the spirit of our upcoming production of Much Ado About Nothing. The festivities will include (but are certainly not limited to):

• Local artist booths • Local musicians • Local food trucks • Masquerade mask contest (bring your own!) • Face painting • Silent auction • more to come…

But to get tickets, you gotta get in on the action by contributing to our Indiegogo campaign!

The Impact

We're a very small local business that has only been in existence since 2014. In fact, KCT's original start-up money was raised through an Indiegogo campaign! Well, we're reaching for the stars again, and hoping that you can help us! 

We want to continue to provide opportunities to emerging artists, keep our performing arts talent in Indiana, and provide a safe space for self-expression for everyone. PLEASE consider contributing to our campaign so that we can continue to provide quality art to audiences, you and emerging artists. 

Risks & Challenges

We realize that $30,000 is an ambitious goal! Even if we fall short of the total we hope to raise, we'll still get the proceeds that are donated through Indiegogo so you don't have to worry that your contribution won't reach us! The expansion costs that we are looking to cover are paid month by month so even if we don't reach our projected goal, the donations will still be used to cover the month to month costs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute! You can still help! Share this Indiegogo campaign with all of your friends! OR

Visit our website: www.kctindy.com

Like us on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/kctindy/

And buy tickets to our upcoming shows! www.kctindy.com 

We hope you'll support Khaos Company Theatre and our artists!

We hope you'll support Khaos Company Theatre and our artists!

story:
Cry It Out started as a monologue that needed more space. Each scene in Cry It Out represents a different take, opinion, truth about race when it comes to dealing with the police.  

The Playwright

My name is Danielle Faulkner and I am a working playwright. I have a job that has nothing to do with playwriting but allows me the time and capital to write. I write instead of going to a therapist. I write when I can’t shake a rant I have stored in my mind. I write to heal. The bonus of my writing is the chance to see my work lived outside my head.  As a working playwright, I have to crave out time to write. I take this time very seriously and make every effort to write every day for one hour. Prior to becoming a working playwright, I was a fellow, an IT professional, and a liberal arts student. My physical body is in Baltimore City but my heart and soul are forever on the Eastern Shore of Maryland.

Why This? Why Now?

Professionally, this is the right time for me to pursue this project because it just is. As a playwright I am always writing, always creating, always striving to complete my next piece of theatre. Personally, I am now far enough removed from my initial raw emotions addressed in this piece to share it with the world. For me, this project is a form of healing. I recognize that there are many around me that have the same feelings and thoughts but are unable to express them freely. This project will serve as a safe place to release said feelings.  

Risks and Challenges

The main risk to the show is its financial costs; if I can't pay the venue then I can't hold a  performance!  Due to the nature of the things, I can't rely on ticket sales so I am looking to pay off all production costs before the play opens. However, I am not just relying on the generosity of our Indiegogo backers for funding. I have applied for a grant through the Greater Baltimore Culture Alliance and plan to host fundraising events in Baltimore to fund this project.

Performance

The play will be shown to the public in the form of two (2) staged readings. A stage reading is a form of theatre without sets or full costumes. I believe a staged reading will be the best vehicle for this piece because the audience will only have the dialogue to focus on.  After each production, actors, and those interested, will be invited to take part in a roundtable to discussion the sentiments portrayed throughout the play. 

Who Benefits?

From my own personal experiences to conversations I’ve had with friends to ease dropping on complete strangers—the events of Freddie Gray and those that followed stuck a cord. There lacked an outlet to explore the lasting affect the events had on our lives. Whether you are black, white, or brown—you had a reaction. The reactions caused an affect. The affect changed the way you live your life and interact with others. Cry It Out is a play that is meant to bring those reactions together to show that they are all interconnected.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you are not able to give money directly through Indiegogo, however there are other ways that you can support me! 

The first way is to follow me on social media:

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/faulknerdl/

From there you can keep up to do date with all information related to this production.

The second way is to share this Indiegogo page with your friends and family.

The third way is to text and/or call me regularly to check in on me to make sure I'm not going crazy through this process. This is my first try at self-producing and I'm going to need everyone's help to remain sane during the process.

From the bottom of my heart thank you very much!

-Dani Faulkner

story:
Kismet!

In 2017 Troupe Zaghareet will bring back its fusion of different dance styles--bellydance, hip hop, tango, modern, salsa, breakdance, etc.--to the 2017 Cairo Shimmyquake.  This year we will do a version of "Kismet."

But we need your help.  Frankly, we need to raise whatever we can to help pay the dancers, make the costumes and rent the space for rehearsals. Not only for "Kismet" but other shows as well!  In return we do wish to offer some perks:

  • A public "THANK YOU" from Troupe Zaghareet across social media [$5}
  • A digital download link to a performance by Troupe Zaghareet for your very own [$10]
  • Autographed 8x10 glossy color photo of the troupe [$25]
  • A coffee mug emblazoned with the Troupe Zaghareet logo [$50]
  • A t-shirt emblazoned with the Troupe Zaghareet logo [$100]
  • Complimentary dinner with several--at least three--troupe members [$300]

story:
Hey lovelings! 
This IndieGoGo campaign has ended & this production of GYNX is over. 

If you didn't get to see GYNX in person, you can now purchase a "virtual ticket" to watch a recording of GYNX online!

GYNX Virtual Theater

 

---

What is GYNX?

GYNX (pronounced "jinx") is a full-length play written by award-winning writer Alicen Grey, set to premiere at Thespis Theatre Festival in August 2017!

Show dates:

MONDAY August 21st, 6:15pm
FRIDAY August 25th, 9:00pm
SUNDAY August 27th, 3:30pm

@ Hudson Guild Theatre in NYC

Here's the plot:

A homeless teen lesbian, a prostituted girl, an underground abortionist, and a former child porn victim are recruited into a rapist castration plot by a mysterious woman named Gynx. Men go into hiding, women take over the streets, and their operation makes global headlines.

But when Gynx’s true motives are revealed, the group is forced to question whether they are truly on the side of justice.

---

For all the info, visit www.gynxtheplay.com

 

Here's why you'll love it:

  • GYNX passes every feminist media test out there
  • GYNX raises awareness about feminist issues such as LGBT homelessness, human trafficking, child pornography, reproductive autonomy... and, of course, rape culture
  • GYNX is written, directed and performed by women. (Considering the fact that theater has a history of excluding women from productions, this is kind of a big deal.)
  • It's about castrating rapists. (Come on, who doesn't want to see that?)
  • It's entertaining as f*ck

This is your chance to support a female playwright, her woman-powered production team, feminist theater, and independent art, all in one shot.

 

Why We Need You

If you've never been involved in a theatrical production, you may not understand why we're asking for thousands of dollars. So to give you an idea, here's just a light sampling of the resources we need to put this show together:

  • Thespis Festival participation fee
  • director fee
  • actors (of course)
  • a lighting designer
  • a sound designer
  • a cue board operator
  • a stage manager
  • a set designer
  • props
  • set-building materials
  • a costume designer
  • costumes
  • audition space
  • rehearsal space
  • promotional material
  • security fees
  • a photographer
  • a videographer
  • IndieGoGo platform fees
  • printing costs for perks...

You get the idea.

 

"How can I help?"

Glad you asked!

Theatrical productions are incredibly resource-intensive, and every little bit counts. So whether you can donate $1, $100 or $1,000, we'll be profoundly grateful either way! 

***NOTE: Thespis Theater Festival does not allow us to comp tickets for people. Meaning, we can't include tickets in the perks [sad face]. So please be mindful: regardless of what you donate to this fund, you must buy your live show tickets separately. You can purchase your tickets HERE.

Donating money not your thing? That's cool. You can still help us out by buying props for us! Check out our Amazon Wishlist!

Also, share this IndieGoGo campaign with your friends and family!!!

 

This show can't happen without your help.

From the bottom of our hearts,
thank you so much.

- Alicen & GYNX team
